title: Wolfgang Weingart (sp?)
content:
Can anyone link me to any good examples of his typographic work? Just looking for some inspiration from him.

Cheers

James
author: James Scriven

comments.content:
Here's one that has some well-known pieces...  
 [http://balladora.blogspot.com/2007/03/wolfgang-weingart-works.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145710/http:/balladora.blogspot.com/2007/03/wolfgang-weingart-works.html "http://balladora.blogspot.com/2007/03/wolfgang-weingart-works.html")

MoMA has some, too:  
 [http://moma.org/collection/browse\_results.php?criteria=O%3AAD%3AE%3A6289...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145710/http:/moma.org/collection/browse_results.php?criteria=O%3AAD%3AE%3A6289&page_number=1&template_id=6&sort_order=1 "http://moma.org/collection/browse\_results.php?criteria=O%3AAD%3AE%3A6289&page\_number=1&template\_id=6&sort\_order=1")

The rest of these links contain more text than images, I'm afraid...

[http://www.weingartarchive.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145710/http:/www.weingartarchive.com/ "http://www.weingartarchive.com/")

[http://www.the-artists.org/ArtistView.cfm?id=37A0AAE0-F88D-EE73-59EF20FF...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145710/http:/www.the-artists.org/ArtistView.cfm?id=37A0AAE0-F88D-EE73-59EF20FF8EBAEB7A "http://www.the-artists.org/ArtistView.cfm?id=37A0AAE0-F88D-EE73-59EF20FF8EBAEB7A")

James, I presume you're within reach of a library? Because you could always go and borrow [his book...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145710/http:/www.amazon.com/Wolfgang-Weingart-My-Way-Typography/dp/390704486X/ref=pd_bbs_sr_1/102-5481549-6053713?ie=UTF8&s=books&qid=1176271846&sr=1-1)

There's also quite a lot of Weingart in person in [Kathryn Cho's documentary movie 'Typecast'.](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145710/http:/www.typecastfilm.com/index.htm) But I understand it's the work you're looking for, rather than the man.
The library in my town stinks, it's got nothing in terms of design. . . But I'll buy it some time soon. Thanks for the input guys.

Actually it's not about what is currently on their shelves – but what they can _borrow from other libraries on your behalf._ You need to find out about inter library loan (ILL) [http://typophile.com/node/31868](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019145710/http:/typophile.com/node/31868 "http://typophile.com/node/31868")
